image.altText: ANU generic

props.synopsis: The Australian National University abandons its plans for forced redundancies as part of its efforts to cut costs.

title.children: ANU walks back plans for forced redundancies

image.altText: A woman walking outside court.

props.synopsis: A Canberra court hears a former business owner who pleaded guilty to sexual offences against three former employees has shown no remorse for her offending, instead portraying her actions as consensual to minimise her responsibility.

title.children: Former Canberra business owner jailed for grooming teen employees

image.altText: A close up of a woman standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: Negotiations between the ACT government and ACT Greens will lead to the return of a lifeline for renters on the financial brink.

title.children: 'Would be living in my car': ACT rent relief scheme to be resurrected

image.altText: Neville Bonner in bronze.

props.synopsis: Neville Bonner is honoured as Australia's first Indigenous parliamentarian with a bronze sculpture commemorating his life and legacy outside Old Parliament House.

title.children: First Indigenous parliamentarian's iconic boomerang throw immortalised

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a suit holds a framed image of a young woman to his chest outside a courthouse.

props.synopsis: The father of a 22-year-old woman who died after her motorbike collided with a bus earlier this year has given emotional statement outside court, as the bus driver is spared jail for negligent driving causing death.

title.children: 'No sentence can bring my daughter back': Bus driver spared jail over crash

image.altText: An older man with white hair gets out of the driver's side of a car.

props.synopsis: Bishop Pat Power is being remembered as a much-loved Canberran who leaves a legacy of compassion and hope.

title.children: 'Supporter for the marginalised': Tireless campaigner Bishop Pat Power dies

image.altText: A team of men in matching green rugby jerseys stands in a group in front of a large winners plaque.

props.synopsis: Two weeks ago, the Canberra Raiders won the NRL's 2025 minor premiership by beating the Wests Tigers. It is their first minor premiership since 1990, and a lot has changed since then.

title.children: How things have changed since the Canberra Raiders last won a minor premiership

image.altText: Queen Camilla, King Charles, Donald and Melanie Trump standing in formal wear and smiling on a red carpet

props.synopsis: Surrounded by high-level politicians, a media mogul, tech giants and athletes, the grandeur-loving US president was treated to a glowing spectacle at Windsor Castle.

title.children: Donald Trump's historic banquet dinner visit in pictures

image.altText: An old man in a suit walks with his male lawyer amongst a media scrum.

props.synopsis: Eleven counts of aggravated indecent assault against the veteran broadcaster have been dropped in what the magistrate described as a "reformation" of the case.

title.children: Alan Jones's defence lawyer hails 'very big development' in charges

image.altText: the entrance to a kmart store

props.synopsis: The privacy commissioner has found Kmart broke the Privacy Act with its use of facial recognition technology, ordering the retail giant not to repeat the practice.

title.children: Use of facial recognition technology in Kmart stores broke privacy act

image.altText: The headquarters of oil and gas company Santos.

props.synopsis: The investment arm of Abu Dhabi's state-owned oil company has dropped its $30 billion takeover bid for Santos.

title.children: Abu Dhabi consortium drops $30b bid to take over Santos

image.altText: A group of black cows gathered around fresh hay in a dry field.

props.synopsis: Australian cow prices are at record highs, but are still way below the United States where beef demand is going "crazy".

title.children: Record Aussie cow price as US demand hits 'scary times'

image.altText: Gout Gout runs

props.synopsis: Gout Gout could have been rattled competing against some of the world's best in the 200m at the World Athletics Championships, but powered through with an assured display beyond his years.

title.children: Against the best in the world, Australia's Gout proves he belongs

image.altText: ASX boards

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate remains steady at 4.2 per cent in August with a decline in full-time employment that drove the overall drop in employment numbers, according to ABS. Follow live.

title.children: ASX slips amid Santos sell-off, weak jobs data and 2035 emissions target

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: More than half sectors slip with ASX
ASX drops as Australian energy giants plough
Australia's population grows by 1.6pc, ABS data reveals

image.altText: A silhouette of a woman sitting at a table with a laptop.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate remains steady at 4.2 per cent in August, despite more than 5,000 jobs being lost last month.

title.children: Jobs market 'running out of steam' despite steady unemployment rate

image.altText: Two cavoodles wearing a pilot and air hostess costume

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia has finally announced the start date of a trial of pets on flights, beginning next month between Melbourne and the Gold and Sunshine coasts.

title.children: Virgin's pets on planes trial gets mixed reaction

image.altText: A composite of Susan Close and Stephen Mullighan. Susan has brown hair and wears red jacket. Stephen has a suit

props.synopsis: South Australia's Deputy Premier Susan Close and Treasurer Stephen Mullighan will quit politics and not contest next year's state election, Premier Peter Malinauskas has announced.

title.children: SA Deputy Premier and Treasurer to quit politics ahead of state election

image.altText: AFL club captains sit around the 2025 premiership cup

props.synopsis: Three captains from the AFL's four worst-performing clubs are searching for the exit door. It is the symptom of a player movement era that has left the gap between the AFL's strongest and weakest larger than ever.

title.children: How arrival of mass player movement era 'completely backfired' on the AFL

image.altText: PNG Kumuls

props.synopsis: Observers say Papua New Guinea's decades-long history of rugby league success and passion is on its side as it prepares for the next sporting leap into the NRL.

title.children: How PNG is preparing to turn a national obsession into a sporting 'birthright'

image.altText: Aung San Suu Ky looks intensely into the camera at a conference.

props.synopsis: One of the world's most recognised pro-democracy activists needs urgent medical care as she serves a 27-year sentence in a "hellhole" prison, her son has claimed.

title.children: Former human rights leader now stuck in a prison 'hellhole', son claims

image.altText: Chappell Roan stands on top of a big toy horse in a Western costume with her hair out and an arm raised

props.synopsis: The Midwest Princess is finally coming back to see us with her first national tour of Australia.

title.children: Chappell Roan, PinkPantheress and more saddle up for Laneway Festival 2026

image.altText: Tyler Robinson sitting emotionless in front of a white brick wall while wearing an armless green prison top

props.synopsis: Tyler Robinson, the Utah man accused of killing political activist Charlie Kirk, only agreed to surrender if it was done peacefully, a sheriff involved with his arrest says.

title.children: Alleged Kirk killer surrendered in fear of being shot by police, sheriff says

image.altText: Uniformed police set up a road block on a rural road with helpers in hi-vis vests with police car flashing lights in background

props.synopsis: Pennsylvania police are investigating after three of their own were killed and another two wounded in a shooting near the rural area of North Codorus Township.

title.children: Three police officers dead and two wounded in rural Pennsylvania shooting

image.altText: grey smoke rises over gaza after an explosion in the area

props.synopsis: The European Union's executive arm has made a series of proposals aimed at forcing an end to the Israel–Hamas conflict.

title.children: European Commission proposes new sanctions on Israel over war in Gaza

image.altText: A man with grey hair and beard, wearing glasses, poses with a tub of ice-cream

props.synopsis: Ben & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield resigns after a feud with parent company Unilever over the war in Gaza.

title.children: Ben & Jerry's co-founder quits over Gaza dispute with parent company Unilever

image.altText: A close up of a woman's torso where there is a scar and the Olympic rings tattooed on top of it.

props.synopsis: Making it to the Paris 2024 Olympics was a career highlight for Jean Mitchell — and the brain cancer survivor marked the achievement in a special way.

title.children: Why this rower got an Olympic rings tattoo over her chemo scar

image.altText: People disembark from a plane on the tarmac

props.synopsis: Low passenger numbers force Qantas to pull the plug on flights between Perth and Busselton, less than three months after the route was launched.

title.children: Qantas axes 45min flight between Perth and Busselton due to low demand

image.altText: Hayley Reynolds in blue dress outside pyramids in desert

props.synopsis: As Sydneysiders struggle with the soaring cost of living, a teacher has found financial freedom thousands of kilometres away, while a digital marketer swaps the city for the bush to save up $100,000.

title.children: 'Groceries cheaper here': Sydney's financial gap year exodus

image.altText: Animated characters in a small town, a female character with large horns sits in a red dress on a bench.

props.synopsis: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

title.children: This Aussie game broke the internet. A new exhibit reveals how it was made

image.altText: Charlotte Sangster leans against door frame looking upwards

props.synopsis: A patient of NSW's first dedicated long COVID clinic in Sydney says she is "devastated" and "bewildered" that it will close at the end of the month.

title.children: Patient feels 'abandoned' as NSW's first long COVID clinic closes

image.altText: A man dressed in a grey suit speaking on a stage.

props.synopsis: Prominent left-wing commentator Hasan Piker opens up to 7.30 on Donald Trump's left-wing crackdown, the Charlie Kirk he knew and attempts to have him deplatformed.

title.children: Political opponent speaks out against 'dishonest' Charlie Kirk rhetoric

image.altText: vogel gfx

props.synopsis: The chair of the Northern Territory's Environment Protection Authority has become a "strategic adviser" to a miner but denies he has a conflict of interest.

title.children: NT environment regulator takes side job with miner amid calls to quit over gas leak 'scandal'

image.altText: A kangaroo sticking its tongue out in the bush, very close to the camera.

props.synopsis: Citizen scientists have collected more than 1.4 million photos and 15,000 hours of audio recordings to help shape the future of conservation management.

title.children: Landholders capture more than 1.4m photos in wildlife diversity lesson
